Mark Higgins, Co-Founder and Chief Analytics Officer of Beacon— A Next Generation Platform for Quants | by Andrew Janssens | Wharton FinTech | Medium Sitemap Open in app Sign up Sign in Medium Logo Write Sign up Sign in Wharton FinTech · We are FinTech thought leaders connecting innovators, academics, and investors with the ideas and products that are reinventing global financial services. Mark Higgins, Co-Founder and Chief Analytics Officer of Beacon— A Next Generation Platform for Quants Andrew Janssens 4 min read · Oct 27, 2022 -- Listen Share Press enter or click to view image in full size In this episode, I’m joined by Mark Higgins, Co-Founder and Chief Analytics Officer of Beacon , a development environment for quants, built to balance the rigor of enterprise software with the freedom of quantitative development and problem solving in public markets. Mark and I cover a range of topics, including: Mark’s Background: “My first job before I was at Goldman, I was the only developer at this little FinTech that was building trading system for for a Virginia power utility… We had to figure it all out on the spot, which was a great learning experience for me. They had their own, initial market crises when power prices (which normally were like $30, a megawatt hour) went to like $3,000 because some power plant unexpectedly went offline. And so half the hedge funds made a ton of money when power prices went from $30 to $3,000. And the other half of them went bankrupt.” Mark began his career as a PhD in physics, before moving over to the world of finance. His start in the world of trading and derivatives began at a small commodity trading desk, building risk trading systems as the team’s sole quant. A few years later, he would go on to Goldman Sachs on the Foreign Exchange Trading desk, where he met Kirat Singh his co-founder at Beacon, and began to work on Goldman’s SecDB platform. Goldman and SecDB: “But you know, [Kirat and I] kind of grew up at Goldman, in the SecDB platform, which is a really interesting combination of a derivatives focused-trading and risk management system. So the system where you do trades with people, if you book them, and then you can see all the portfolio of stuff that you have and see how much money you make or lose in different market scenarios… And then they have this development platform that was part of the system, which is where all of us would actually write all of our code. So all the data was there that we needed, all the trades and positions and market data and reference data and everything was already in there.” Mark and Kirat cut their teeth at Goldman where they became familiar with testing software at scale in the same environment that trades and risk were being analyzed. From their time at SecDB, and subsequently at JP Morgan and BAML, Mark and Kirate started to sketch the outline of the architectural model and environment that would later become Beacon. Founding Beacon and solving the enterprise development problem: “Maybe one guy downloads, Python, and another person builds stuff in C++ and another one uses R. And all those things solve these little point business problems when they come up. But then three years later, you’ve got hundreds of these little disconnected point solutions, and everything kind of grinds to a halt. ” Mark explains how quants’ tendency to begin problem solving “side-of-desk” can work in the short run, but will ultimately hamstring a trading desk. We continue to discuss the benefits of Beacon’s production environment and to what degree he thinks Goldman’s SecDB was to credit for their performance in the 2008 financial crisis. The Appeal of Finance for PhDs: “I didn’t even know that quantitative finance existed when I was doing my physics PhD. Physics is exciting and intellectually interesting, but it’s slow — you work on something for months, or years, and you publish papers. And there are maybe six people in the world who know what your thing is.” We discuss whether Finance (specifically quantitative work) is still appealing for PhDs coming out of today’s doctorate programs. The Latest Applications of AI/ML in trading: “… and so the idea with deep hedging, is to say, well, instead of all this sort of risk neutral gunk, we’re just going to train a neural net to figure out the best hedges for your derivatives portfolio. And in the limit, where all those risk neutral assumptions apply, then the best hedges are the risk neutral hedges, and so it reproduces all the stuff that we’ve traditionally done, but then it sort of generalizes to the space where risk neutral pricing doesn’t work. ” Mark explains “deep hedging” a new application of machine learning and neural nets facilitated by technologies such as Beacon. About Mark Higgins: Mark Higgins (PhD) is a veteran of the finance industry, and a true technologist with a PhD in astrophysics. Before co-founding Beacon with Kirat Singh in 2014, Mark spent eight years at JP Morgan, launching and delivering the Athena project, and co-heading the quantitative research group for the investment bank. Prior to JP Morgan he spent eight years at Goldman Sachs where he worked on Goldman’s legendary SecDB. ___ About the Author: Andrew Janssens is a second-year MBA Candidate at The Wharton School, where he is part of the Wharton FinTech Podcast team. He has a passion for the nerdy corners of financial services, venture capital, and all things FinTech. Don’t hesitate to reach out with questions, comments, feedback, and opportunities at ajanss@wharton.upenn.edu. ___ For more insights from FinTech leaders, follow: Wharton FinTech Twitter | Medium | LinkedIn | Facebook | Instagram Andrew Janssens Twitter | LinkedIn Fintech Trading Trading System Development -- -- Published in Wharton FinTech 5.1K followers · Last published Aug 15, 2024 We are FinTech thought leaders connecting innovators, academics, and investors with the ideas and products that are reinventing global financial services. Othman Belkadi Joins Luminary Hotel & Co. as General Manager of The Silver King Ocean Brasserie - Luminary Hotel & Co. (Feb. 9, 2022) – Luminary Hotel & Co. is pleased to announce the appointment of Othman Belkadi as the new general manager of the hotel’s signature restaurant, The Silver King Ocean Brasserie . In his new position, Belkadi will work alongside the culinary team to revamp and refine the restaurant’s menus, add new prix fixe offerings, and elevate the overall guest experience with enhanced service training. “Othman brings a depth of experience and energy to our team that will secure The Silver King as a world-class dining destination,” said Steve Adams, director of food and beverage. “His enthusiasm for food and wine and his unique international perspective will bring a new sophistication to the restaurant and the dining experience.” With more than 25 years of experience in food and beverage operations, Belkadi’s career highlights include high-profile leadership and management roles at restaurants in New York City, Atlanta, Orlando, Miami, Marrakech and Casablanca. He received the permanent HACCP certification for Food Safety Handling in 2008 and has created detailed programs to train staff on the highest safety and handling standards. Born and raised in Casablanca, Morocco, Belkadi speaks English, French, Spanish and Arabic. He relocated to the United States as a teenager and graduated from the State University of New York (SUNY) New Paltz, where he received a degree in Business Administration. As the hotel’s signature restaurant, The Silver King Brasserie features a menu of fresh Florida seafood prepared using classic techniques appealing to the modern palate. The sophisticated restaurant centers upon an open kitchen and chef-driven menu, offering a high-end dining experience that is still comfortably casual. The Silver King Ocean Brasserie is located inside the Luminary Hotel & Co. and is open Tuesday through Saturday from 5 to 10 p.m. For more information on The Silver King Ocean Brasserie and Luminary Hotel & Co., visit LuminaryHotel.com . ### About Luminary Hotel & Co. On Sept. 23, 2020, the waterfront Luminary Hotel & Co. opened its doors, soaring 12 stories above downtown Fort Myers, Florida, as the area’s first hotel in the prestigious Autograph Collection® of Marriott International. More than a hotel, the AAA Four Diamond Luminary is a hub of excitement and discovery – a focal point where locals and travelers tap into the collective energy of a city, and a story, begun by a brilliant cast of audacious local luminaries. The 243-room boutique hotel is home to the signature Silver King Ocean Brasserie and Lobby Bar; Beacon Social Drinkery rooftop lounge; Ella Mae's Diner; Oxbow Bar & Grill; Dean Street Coffee Roaster & Retail; The Workshop culinary theater; an indoor and outdoor fitness facility; and a spacious pool area on the fourth floor featuring an event deck overlooking the Caloosahatchee River. Luminary offers 10,000 square feet of adaptable indoor and outdoor function space ideal for a variety of events and meetings and is adjacent to the neighboring Caloosa Sound Convention Center. The hotel also offers convenient access to the new Caloosa Sound Amphitheater located on the Caloosahatchee and scheduled to open in early 2022. An established company with a dynamic entrepreneurial spirit, Mainsail prides itself in finding unique lodging opportunities with a purpose and applying its passion and expertise to each project. Founded by President Joe Collier with a combination of daring vision and dogged determination, Mainsail has built an impressive portfolio of top-branded properties throughout the southeastern United States and Caribbean. Each Mainsail property inspires guests with a distinct character and meticulously crafted, sophisticated style, from a private island resort, and urban culinary showplaces, to waterfront marvels, boutique southern hotels, and a historic jazz era icon. Stay Sojo, Mainsail’s newest brand, provides short-term furnished living options across the country, while Mainsail Vacation Rentals manages a collection of private vacation homes in Florida and the Caribbean. To ensure long-term success and profitability, Mainsail relies on the dedication of its high-performing leadership team, a growing group of enterprising investors, and a commitment to giving back, every step of the way. Each hotel is a product of passion and a personal realization of its individual founder’s vision, making each hotel singular and special: Exactly Like Nothing Else . Hand-selected for their inherent craft and distinct perspectives on design and hospitality, Autograph Collection hotels offer rich immersive moments that leave a lasting imprint. Expands Executive Team January 2020 FORT MYERS, Fla. (January 30, 2020) – Luminary Hotel & Co., the 243-room hotel that will light up downtown Fort Myers in late 2020, announced today three new additions to the hotel’s executive team, including Tom Albrecht, Director of Sales; Rhonda Decherd, Director of Catering & Convention Services; and Lesley Miller, Area Director of Human Resources. “The team we’re forming at Luminary Hotel & Co. is truly exceptional,” said Bob Megazzini, General Manager. “Our employees are at the heart of our guest experience and we look forward to seeing these talented executives lead our team to continued growth and success.” Director of Sales Tom Albrecht will handle training and supervision of the sales team. Albrecht has more than 30 years of sales experience in convention center, hotel and public assembly facilities, working with such organizations as the Detroit Metropolitan Convention and Visitors Bureau (DMCVB), the Cobo Center, and most recently Detroit Marriott, where he was responsible for selling the 1,328-room hotel to national and state associations. As the former Director of Sales at Cobo Center, he doubled the number of annual major event bookings within his first three years. Albrecht completed his undergraduate studies at City College in New York. Rhonda Decherd has been appointed Director of Catering & Convention Services to oversee the catering sales and event team while maximizing event revenues, convention services efficiencies, and the overall guest experience. Prior to joining Luminary Hotel & Co., Decherd was Director of Catering and Conferences at South Seas Island Resort in Captiva, Florida. She also worked as Event Services Manager at the City of Fort Myers Harborside Event Center for five years, which Luminary Hotel is now managing and recently rebranded. Decherd obtained her bachelor’s degree in Resort & Hospitality Management from Florida Gulf Coast University in Fort Myers. Luminary’s new Area Director of Human Resources Lesley Miller will oversee HR strategy for both the Luminary Hotel and Innovation Hotel in Naples, as the two prepare to recruit, hire and train more than 250 employees, many from Fort Myers and the surrounding area. An accomplished human resources executive, Miller brings more than 20 years of hospitality industry experience, including her most recent position as Director of Human Resources for Carillon Miami Wellness Resort. She was also instrumental in the successful opening of the Acqualina Resort & Spa and The Mandarin Oriental, two of Miami’s most notable 5-star properties. Miller earned her degree in Hospitality Management at Florida International University. Luminary Hotel & Co. will be home to the signature Silver King Ocean Brasserie, as well as the Beacon Social Drinkery rooftop lounge, The Workshop culinary theater, an indoor and outdoor fitness facility, Ella Mae's Diner and retail space at street level and a spacious pool area on the fourth floor overlooking the Caloosahatchee. The 12-story hotel will also offer more than 8,000 square feet of function space and will be connected to the neighboring Harborside Event Center. Adjacent to the property is Centennial Park, where a new bandshell will be constructed, along with a new waterfront restaurant and retail outfitter, Oxbow Bar & Grill, which will be located in the city-owned pier building. The Luminary Hotel will be a part of the prestigious Autograph Collection® of Marriott International, Inc. (NYSE: MAR), and is expected to be the first Autograph hotel in the Fort Myers-Naples area. # # # About Mainsail Lodging & Development LLC Mainsail Lodging & Development is a Tampa-based hospitality company that develops and operates lodging products in the Southeastern U.S. and the Caribbean. Their property portfolio includes four Autograph Collection hotels: Scrub Island Resort, Spa & Marina ( ScrubIsland.com ), a private island resort in the British Virgin Islands; the boutique, food-focused Epicurean Hotel ( EpicureanHotel.com ) in Tampa, Florida; Waterline Marina Resort & Beach Club ( WaterlineResort.com ) on Anna Maria Island, Florida; and the historic Fenway Hotel ( FenwayHotel.com ) in Dunedin, Florida; as well as Mainsail Beach Inn ( MainsailBeachInn.com ), a boutique beachfront hotel on Anna Maria Island, Florida and The Karol Hotel ( TheKarolHotel.com ), the first Tribute Portfolio hotel in Pinellas County, Florida. The company also operates corporate housing throughout the Southeast under its Mainsail Corporate Housing brand, as well as exclusively managing the Florida, Georgia, Alabama and Tennessee markets for Oakwood Worldwide ® under both its ExecuStay® ( ExecuStay.com ) and Oakwood ® ( Oakwood.com ) brands. Mainsail Lodging also manages a portfolio of private vacation homes through its Mainsail Vacation Rentals ( MainsailVR.com ) offered on Homes & Villas by Marriott International. Additional future projects include Luminary Hotel & Co. ( LuminaryHotel.com ) in Fort Myers, Florida; Epicurean Atlanta Midtown; an Autograph Collection hotel in Roswell, Georgia; a 128-room Residence Inn in conjunction with an indoor sports complex in Pasco County, Florida; and a historic boutique hotel in Macon, Georgia. Mainsail Lodging’s corporate charity is Feeding Tampa Bay, the largest food rescue and distribution organization in the community. Mainsail actively supports the cause through a variety of employee and guest programs ranging from packing and sorting at the warehouse, to annual events such as the Epic Chef Showdown. Learn more at MainsailHotels.com About Autograph Collection Hotels The Autograph Collection is an evolving ensemble of strikingly independent hotels. Exactly like nothing else, each destination has been selected for its quality, bold originality, rich character and uncommon details. From near to far, iconic to historic, the result is an array of properties that is nothing less than unique, nothing short of collectively exceptional. For more information and reservations please visit www.autographhotels.com , or explore our social media channels to learn more about championing the independent spirit. Learn More Home Gather Caloosa Sound Convention Center Stay Rooms & Suites Amenities Health & Safety Offers Taste The Silver King Coastal Kitchen Ella Mae’s Diner Beacon Social Drinkery Dean Street Coffee Oxbow Bar & Grill Chips Sports Pub Explore Shopping Attractions Downtown Events Calendar Gather Event Venues Meetings & Events Weddings & Celebrations Caloosa Convention Center Caloosa Sound Amphitheater The Workshop Request A Proposal Location Area Airports Driving Directions Events Calendar Reservations (833) 918-1512 Gather in Good Company Fueled by the energy of a bustling downtown and the river’s sense of discovery, our adjacent convention center is completely managed by Luminary’s team of experts. No third-party contracts. Featuring spectacular catering and versatile event spaces. Request for Proposal Our events team would love to hear about your upcoming occasion. Complete our form below or attach your RFP. Submit An RFP Or Call 239.314.3729 Caloosa Ballroom Galleria & Grand Foyer Amphitheater Caloosa Ballroom Our largest space for your most spectacular function. Divisible into five rooms with a variety of configurations to accommodate 150 or 3,000 attendees. Galleria & Grand Foyer Spacious areas bathed in natural light affording views of the park and riverfront. Thoughtful features such as an outdoor terrace make these areas ideal for entertaining, registration or sponsor exhibits. Amphitheater Located across from our indoor spaces, our expansive park on the Caloosahatchee provides endless opportunities for gatherings al fresco on the lawn. Learn More Floor Plans & Capacities Discover all our venues; either at Luminary Hotel & Co. or Caloosa Sound. Our event specialists are here to help you design the best solution to exceed your expectations. Download Floor Plans Food & Beverage Event Services Audio Visual & More Food & Beverage Caloosa Sound is delighted to offer corporate and social guests unforgettable dining experiences and impeccable service. Allow our expert culinary team the opportunity to create a custom menu specifically for your event or explore our specialty crafted banquet menus. Event Services Allow our enthusiastic and highly trained Event Managers to assist you every step of the way; from creating floorplans, timelines, room blocks, logistics and crafting memorable menus for your meeting or event. Audio Visual & More Take your vision to the next level with a wide range of audio-visual opportunities including sound, video projection, computers, monitors, rigging and specialty lighting through our in-house partners. Encore is the exclusive provider of Production Rigging at the Caloosa Sound Convention Center featuring 80 solid rigging points capable of accommodating 1,000 lbs. max per point. Frequently Asked Questions Can I provide my own food and beverage or bring in an outside catering company? All food and beverage is provided by our on-property culinary staff. No outside catering is permitted. Where is the closest airport? The closest airport is Southwest Florida International Airport (RSW), 16.9 miles from our property. Do you have a business center inside of Caloosa Sound Convention Center? We do not provide a business center. However, our team is happy to provide you with nearby resources. Is the Convention Center directly attached to Luminary Hotel & Co.? Luminary Hotel is directly adjacent to and just steps from the front door of the Caloosa Sound Convention Center & Amphitheater. Is there complimentary Wi-Fi? The lobby areas of Caloosa Sound Convention Center have complimentary Wi-Fi. Internet solutions are available for purchase through PSAV in each meeting venue. What are the available parking options? There is parking at Luminary Hotel’s parking garage or across the street at the City of Palms parking garage. Metered parking is also available Downtown. What is the role of my Event Manager? Once you sign your contract, an Event Manager will be assigned to you. The Event Manager will contact you before the event, assist in detailing of your event and follow up with you at the conclusion of the event. The primary responsibility of your Event Manager is to gather and communicate your event details and information to our various in-house departments, to make sure your event is in compliance with the rules and regulations of the Center and to ensure your event runs smoothly. Your Caloosa Sound Event Manager is your primary hub for venue information and is available to assist in making your event successful. Are there rigging capabilities in the Convention Center? Yes, Encore is the exclusive provider of Production Rigging at the Caloosa Sound Convention Center. The Caloosa Sound Ballroom features 80 solid rigging points capable of accommodating 1,000 lbs. max per point. About Us – Beacon Outreach Menu Home Our Programs Events Resources Gallery Testimonials About Us Our Team Get Involved Donate Home Our Programs Events Resources Gallery Testimonials About Us Our Team Get Involved About Us Home About Us Our Mission To restore hope, empower individuals, and transform communities by providing holistic support through faith-based outreach programs. Who We Are Beacon Outreach is a faith-driven humanitarian initiative committed to transforming lives and uplifting communities through the love of Christ. Our mission is to be a beacon of hope, compassion, and empowerment for the underprivileged, bringing sustainable solutions to societal challenges. We believe that true transformation happens when faith meets action. Through our various outreach programs, we provide critical support in education, healthcare, community development, and evangelism, ensuring that individuals and families have the opportunity to thrive spiritually, socially, and economically. Our Vision To see a world where every individual, regardless of their background or circumstances, experiences the love of Christ through practical interventions that meet their spiritual, physical, and social needs. Our Core Values Compassion Serving with love, kindness, and empathy. Faith Centering all we do on biblical principles. Integrity Upholding transparency, accountability, and honesty. Service Being dedicated to selfless giving and action. Transformation Creating lasting impact in lives and communities. Our Story Beacon Outreach was born out of a divine burden to bridge the gap between faith and action. What began as a small initiative to support local communities has grown into a movement impacting lives across cities and nations. Through years of dedicated service, we have expanded our reach, deepened our impact, and partnered with like-minded individuals and organizations to extend the hands of Jesus to the world. From feeding the hungry and educating children to providing medical aid and supporting rural churches, every effort at Beacon Outreach is fueled by a desire to see lives changed for the better. We are committed to being a lighthouse in dark places, shining the light of God’s love through tangible, life-changing solutions. Join Us Now Donate Now Meet the Team Our work is made possible by a dedicated team of passionate individuals who share a common vision of making a difference. From pastors and community leaders to volunteers and partners, every person plays a crucial role in ensuring our mission is fulfilled. Adaigbe Wisdome Solomon - Pastor | Teacher | Counsellor | Tech Consultant | Transformation Strategist Adaigbe Wisdom Solomon is a distinguished graduate of Economics from Lagos State University and an alumnus of the Word Of Faith Bible Institute (WOFBI). He also studied Marketing and Customer Analytics at The Lauder Institute, University of Pennsylvania. With over 22 years of experience spanning ministry, technology, and training, he is renowned for his innovative strategies that drive operational excellence and productivity. As an IT consultant with expertise in hardware and software, Wisdom Solomon combines his technical acumen with a passion for mentorship and leadership development. His dedication to faith, family, and professional excellence is evident in every aspect of his life. He serves as the President and Lead Pastor of Beacon Christian Center International (BCCi), where he leads with vision and commitment, fostering spiritual growth and development. He is also the President of Beacon Outreach and Beacon Book Club, two vibrant expressions of his passion for community transformation and intellectual empowerment. A devoted pastor, loving husband, and proud father, Wisdom Solomon exemplifies the values of integrity, service, and excellence. Let's connect: Facebook-f Linkedin-in Joshua - Program Coordinator, Beacon Outreach | Purpose-Driven Leader | Music Minister Joshua is a purpose-driven individual whose core values integrity, accountability, and commitment to growth shape his leadership and service. He is a graduate of Energy and Petroleum Studies from the prestigious Novena University* and a dynamic leader with a heart for community transformation and spiritual impact. As the Program Coordinator at Beacon Outreach, Joshua plays a key role in organizing and executing impactful outreach programs that uplift lives and expand the reach of God’s kingdom. His ability to strategically plan, coordinate, and mobilize resources ensures that each initiative delivers meaningful change to communities. Beyond his leadership role, Joshua is a passionate music minister who uses his gift to inspire, uplift, and draw people closer to God. Through his music ministry, he has *impacted countless lives and contributed to the advancement of God’s kingdom. His dedication to excellence, both in administration and ministry, makes him a valuable asset to any team or mission. Joshua is open to collaborations, ministry engagements, and leadership development opportunities Let's connect: Facebook-f X-twitter Linkedin-in Mrs. Jennifer Iyoriovbhe - Health Volunteer Dedicated and compassionate Health personnel with years of continuous working experience, possessing excellent communication and team work skills to deliver high quality care. Proven track record of ensuring safety and well being, key roles , and collaborating with multidisciplinary teams to provide holistic care. A graduate of Sociology and Anthropology from the prestigious University of Benin, and successfully graduated from National institute of Management Studies (NIMS). Currently working as Head of Control / Compliance as well supervisory role as Financial Controller in Financial Organisation. Joyfully married with dynamic children. By the grace of God, a born again Christian. Let's connect: Facebook-f X-twitter Linkedin-in Chinyere Margaret Ikpah - Medical Volunteer Margaret is a goal driven and enthusiastic lady. As a legal advisory services volunteer, she combines spiritual wisdom with legal expertise to empower individuals facing legal and spiritual challenges. Grounded in Christian values and biblical principles, Winifred ensures Beacon Outreach upholds justice, stewardship, and service. Through legal guidance and advocacy, she helps individuals navigate complex issues while inspiring others to use their gifts for God’s kingdom. Let's connect: Facebook-f Adaigbe Joy Onyenenu - Head of Operations, Beacon Outreach | Marriage Counsellor | Prison & Children’s Outreach Minister Adaigbe Joy Onyenenue is a compassionate leader, seasoned marriage counsellor, and a passionate advocate for transformation. As the Head of Operations at Beacon Outreach, she plays a pivotal role in coordinating and executing life-changing programs that impact communities, restore hope, and spread the love of Christ. A graduate of Agricultural Science from the University of Benin, Joy is deeply committed to outreach ministry, leadership, and humanitarian service. Her work spans across prison ministry, children’s outreach, and marriage counselling, where she has helped countless individuals and families find healing, restoration, and direction. Her strategic leadership and unwavering dedication ensure that Beacon Outreach operates with excellence, reaching the lost, serving the needy, and transforming lives through faith and action. She is driven by integrity, compassion, and a strong sense of purpose, making her a pillar of strength within the Beacon Leadership Team. Through her prison ministry, she extends hope and rehabilitation to the incarcerated, offering them a chance at spiritual renewal. Her children’s outreach efforts focus on empowering young lives with faith, education, and love, while her role as a marriage counsellor brings healing and wisdom to homes and relationships. Slide into a booth or pull up to the counter for a burger and milkshake, brunch with the gang or the best all-day breakfast you’ve ever had. Menus Hours View our Video About Most would say stories passed on shape a community. And we know that a good meal is the best way to bring those storytellers together. That’s why our doors open for the early birds and don’t close until the late risers have had their fill—come as you are and whenever you’re ready. We’ll keep the coffee hot, the soda cold, and the rest just the way you like it. Walk right in from Bay Street, where Ella Mae’s provides a welcome twist to the classic southern diner. Our inspired chefs put a fresh approach to a lineup of traditional neighborhood favorites. Celebrating Dr. Ella Mae Piper’s legacy, it’s here the community comes together to share stories as they enjoy a meal amidst vintage-inspired finishes and a bright color palette. Gift Cards Give the perfect gift today! Gift cards can be redeemed for hotel stays, The Silver King Ocean Brasserie, Ella Mae’s Diner, Beacon Rooftop Social Drinkery, Chips Sports Pub, Oxbow Bar & Grill, and Dean Street Coffee Roastery & Retail. Learn More In the late 19th century, Dr. Ella Mae Piper was a visionary, philanthropist and life-changer, and her light would brighten the lives of many in Fort Myers. She opened the first beauty shop in the community. Her entrepreneurial skills blossomed as she became owner of Big 4 Bottling Company on Mango and Evans, where customers could enjoy soft drinks for just 5 cents a bottle. Today’s Dr. Piper Center is located at the former Big 4 site. Philanthropic to the core, Dr. Piper was instrumental in helping young people earn scholarships to Tuskegee College, as well as underprivileged children and the elderly. Although Dr. Piper died in 1954, her legacy lives on at the Dr. Piper Center. Today, the Dr. Piper Center empowers seniors to create community impact in her name. Taking Reservations Ahead of Late Summer Opening March 2020 TAMPA, Fla. (March 02, 2020) – Guests can now book reservations online for Luminary Hotel & Co. (2200 Edwards Drive), scheduled to open late summer as the newest addition to Tampa-based Mainsail Lodging & Development’s growing portfolio. Reservations for stays starting Nov. 1 can be made directly on the hotel’s website, LuminaryHotel.com , or through Marriott.com /RSWAK . Luminary Hotel & Co. will be a part of the prestigious Autograph Collection® of Marriott International, Inc. (NYSE: MAR), and is expected to be the first Autograph hotel in the Fort Myers-Naples area. “It’s truly been a labor of love making Luminary a reality as a central part of this exciting new time in downtown Fort Myers,” said Bob Megazzini, General Manager for Luminary Hotel & Co. “We can’t wait to welcome guests and residents as we take this one step closer to officially opening our doors later this year.” The highly anticipated boutique hotel will feature 243 guest rooms and will be home to the signature Silver King Ocean Brasserie, as well as the Beacon Social Drinkery rooftop lounge, Ella Mae's Diner, The Workshop culinary theater, an indoor and outdoor fitness facility, retail space at street level and a spacious pool area on the fourth floor overlooking the Caloosahatchee. The 12-story hotel will also offer more than 8,000 square feet of function space and will be connected to the neighboring Caloosa Sound Convention Center & Amphitheater. Adjacent to the property is Centennial Park, where a new bandshell will be constructed, along with a new waterfront restaurant and retail outfitter, Oxbow Bar & Grill, which will be located in the city-owned pier building. Luminary Hotel & Co. is located just 16 miles (less than 30 minutes) from the award-winning Southwest Florida International Airport (RSW), one of the top 50 U.S. airports for passenger traffic. For more information on Luminary Hotel & Co., visit LuminaryHotel.com . # # # About Mainsail Lodging & Development LLC Mainsail Lodging & Development is a Tampa-based hospitality company that develops and operates lodging products in the Southeastern U.S. and the Caribbean. Their property portfolio includes four Autograph Collection hotels: Scrub Island Resort, Spa & Marina ( ScrubIsland.com ), a private island resort in the British Virgin Islands; the boutique, food-focused Epicurean Hotel ( EpicureanHotel.com ) in Tampa, Florida; Waterline Marina Resort & Beach Club ( WaterlineResort.com ) on Anna Maria Island, Florida; and the historic Fenway Hotel ( FenwayHotel.com ) in Dunedin, Florida; as well as Mainsail Beach Inn ( MainsailBeachInn.com ), a boutique beachfront hotel on Anna Maria Island, Florida and The Karol Hotel ( TheKarolHotel.com ), the first Tribute Portfolio hotel in Pinellas County, Florida. The company also operates corporate housing throughout the Southeast under its Mainsail Corporate Housing brand, as well as exclusively managing the Florida, Georgia, Alabama and Tennessee markets for Oakwood Worldwide ® under both its ExecuStay® ( ExecuStay.com ) and Oakwood ® ( Oakwood.com ) brands. Mainsail Lodging also manages a portfolio of private vacation homes through its Mainsail Vacation Rentals ( MainsailVR.com ) offered on Homes & Villas by Marriott International. Additional future projects include Luminary Hotel & Co. ( LuminaryHotel.com ) in Fort Myers, Florida; Epicurean Atlanta Midtown; a 128-room Residence Inn in conjunction with an indoor sports complex in Pasco County, Florida; and a historic boutique hotel in Macon, Georgia. Mainsail Lodging’s corporate charity is Feeding Tampa Bay, the largest food rescue and distribution organization in the community. Mainsail actively supports the cause through a variety of employee and guest programs ranging from packing and sorting at the warehouse, to annual events such as the Epic Chef Showdown. Learn more at MainsailHotels.com About Autograph Collection Hotels Autograph Collection Hotels advocates for the original, championing the individuality of each of its over 180 independent hotels located in the most desirable destinations across more than 35 countries and territories. Each is a product of passion and a personal realization of its individual founder’s vision, making each hotel singular and special: Exactly Like Nothing Else . Hand-selected for their inherent craft and distinct perspectives on design and hospitality, Autograph Collection hotels offer rich immersive moments that leave a lasting imprint. For more information, please visit www.autographhotels.com , and explore our social media channels on Instagram , Twitter , and Facebook or follow along to be inspired by immersive moments that are #ExactlyLikeNothingElse.  Autograph Collection Hotels is proud to participate in Marriott Bonvoy, the new name of Marriott’s travel program replacing Marriott Rewards®, The Ritz- Carlton Rewards®, and Starwood Preferred Guest® (SPG). The program offers members an extraordinary portfolio of global brands, experiences on Marriott Bonvoy Moments and unparalleled benefits including earning points toward free hotel stays and nights toward Elite status recognition. To enrol for free or for more information about the program, visit MarriottBonvoy.marriott.com . Appoints New General Manager August 2019 FORT MYERS, Fla. (June 27, 2019) - Luminary Hotel & Co. announced today the appointment of Bob Megazzini as general manager of the 243-room hotel that will light up downtown Fort Myers in late 2020. Megazzini will oversee the hiring of new staff, day-to-day operations, and guest and employee satisfaction at Luminary Hotel, along with the remodeled Harborside Event Center, which will be rebranded, and the planned amphitheater in Centennial Park. "With his hospitality background and flair for outstanding service, Bob is the perfect person to assemble and lead our team as we look ahead to the opening of the Luminary Hotel & Co. next year," said Joe Collier, Mainsail Lodging & Development president. "We're excited to open this hotel with a general manager whose personality and passion seamlessly align with our Mainsail standards and core values." With more than 30 years of experience at several Marriott hotels around the country, Megazzini started his career in the kitchen and worked his way up to Executive Chief at multiple Marriott hotels. After a successful culinary career, he transitioned to food and beverage director and later to director of hotel operations. Megazzini was most recently the area general manager for the JW Marriott Denver and Courtyard Denver Downtown for three years. He and his wife have relocated to Fort Myers from Denver, Colorado, and are both excited to call sunny Florida home. Luminary Hotel & Co. will be home to the signature Silver King Ocean Brasserie, as well as the Beacon Social Drinkery rooftop lounge, The Workshop culinary theater, an indoor and outdoor fitness facility, Ella Mae's Diner and retail space at street level and a spacious pool area on the fourth floor overlooking the Caloosahatchee, The 12-story hotel will also offer more than 8,000 square feet of function space and will be connected to the neighboring Harborside Event Center. Adjacent to the property is Centennial Park, where a new bandshell will be constructed, along with a new waterfront restaurant and retail outfitter, Oxbow Bar & Grill, which will be located in the city-owner pier building. The Luminary Hotel will be a part of the prestigious Autograph Collection® of Marriott International, Inc. (NYSE:MAR), and is expected to be the first Autograph hotel in the Fort Myers-Naples area. ### About Mainsail Lodging & Development LLC Mainsail Lodging & Development is a Tampa-based hospitality company that develops and operates lodging products in the Southeastern US and the Caribbean. Their property portfolio includes four Autograph Collection Hotels: Scrub Island Resort, Spa & Marina ( ScrubIsland.com ), a private island resort in the British Virgin Islands; the boutique, food-focused Epicurean Hotel ( EpicureanHotel.com ) in Tampa, Florida; Waterline Marina Resort & Beach Club ( WaterlineResort.com ) on Anna Maria Island, Florida; and the historic Fenway Hotel ( FenwayHotel.com ) in Dunedin, Florida; as well as Mainsail Beach Inn ( MainsailBeachInn.com ), a boutique beachfront hotel on Anna Maria Island, Florida. The company also operates corporate housing throughout the Southeast, exclusively managing the Florida, Georgia and Tennessee markets for Oakwood Worldwide® under both its ExecuStay® ( ExecuStay.com ) and Oakwood® ( Oakwood.com ) brands. Mainsail Lodging also manages a portfolio of private vacation homes through its Mainsail Vacation Rentals ( MainsailVR.com ) brand and is a select partner of Homes & Villas by Marriott International. Additional future projects include Luminary Hotel & Co. ( LuminaryHotel.com ) in Fort Myers, Florida; a 128-room Residence Inn in conjunction with an indoor sports complex in Pasco County, Florida; and a historic boutique hotel in Macon, Georgia. Mainsail Lodging’s corporate charity is Feeding Tampa Bay, the largest food rescue and distribution organization in the community. Mainsail actively supports the cause through a variety of employee and guest programs ranging from packing and sorting at the warehouse, to annual events such as the Epic Chef Showdown. Learn more at MainsailHotels.com . About Autograph Collection Hotels The Autograph Collection is an evolving ensemble of strikingly independent hotels. Exactly like nothing else, each destination has been selected for its quality, bold originality, rich character and uncommon details. From near to far, iconic to historic, the result is an array of properties that is nothing less than unique, nothing short of collectively exceptional. For more information and reservations please visit www.autographhotels.com, or explore our social media channels to learn more about championing the independent spirit. Announces New Executive Food & Beverage Appointments October 2023 FORT MYERS, Fla. (Oct. 5, 2023) – Luminary Hotel & Co. is pleased to announce the appointment of Joe Pankrath as its new Executive Chef, and Caneale Mills as Director of Food & Beverage for all outlets at the hotel, including The Silver King Ocean Brasserie, Ella Mae’s Diner, Beacon Social Drinkery, Dean Street Coffee Roastery & Retail, Oxbow Bar & Grill, and Chips Sports Pub. This dynamic culinary duo is set to take the dining experience at Luminary Hotel & Co. to new heights, infusing innovation and creativity into every dish and dining concept. “Both Chef Joe and Caneale bring a level of expertise and passion that aligns perfectly with our commitment to culinary excellence,” said Robert “Bobby” Nokley, General Manager of Luminary Hotel & Co. “Together, they will collaborate closely to reimagine and expand our culinary landscape, enriching the existing dining experiences at all outlets.” Pankrath joins Luminary Hotel & Co. with more than two decades of culinary experience in the hotel and restaurant industry. His impressive career includes significant roles such as Senior Sous Chef at the Renaissance Chicago, Executive Sous Chef at JW Marriott Marco Island, and, most recently, the Complex Executive Chef at JW Marriott Tampa Water Street. Throughout his career, Chef Pankrath has demonstrated a curated, yet methodical approach to the culinary industry, resulting in numerous accomplishments, including Marriott’s Guest Satisfaction Survey (GSS) food quality index improvements, best in class food cost and profitability metrics, and the creation of several new outlet concepts and programming. With nearly 20 years in the hospitality industry, Mills joins Luminary Hotel & Co. from the ChampionsGate Country Club in Davenport, Florida, where she served as General Manager. She has previously held roles in the robust Orlando market, including Restaurant Manager at JW Marriott Grande Lakes, and Director of Restaurants at the Orlando World Center Marriott. Mills also served as Director of Food & Beverage at the Sawgrass Marriott Golf Resort & Spa in Ponte Vedra from 2014 to 2020, where she made significant contributions to the hotel's culinary excellence. Mills has also been running her own consulting business since 2021, showcasing her dedication to the food and beverage industry. As Director of Food & Beverage at Luminary, Mills will guide the success of all dining outlets and the complex banquet team, working closely with Chef Pankrath. Guests of Luminary Hotel & Co. and locals alike have ample options to explore their culinary curiosity – from a signature restaurant and rooftop bar to a casual streetside diner and sports pub. The Silver King Ocean Brasserie is located inside the Luminary Hotel & Co. and is open Tuesday through Saturday from 5 to 10 p.m. Ella Mae’s Diner , located on the hotel’s ground floor with access to Bay Street, is open Monday through Sunday from 7 a.m. to 2 p.m. Located 12 stories up, the rooftop Beacon Social Drinkery is open on Sundays from 3 to 9 p.m.; Monday through Thursday 4  to 10 p.m.; and Friday and Saturday from 4 p.m. to midnight. Located just steps from the hotel on the Caloosahatchee River, Oxbow Bar & Grill is open Sunday through Thursday from 11 a.m. to 9 p.m. and Friday and Saturday from 11 a.m. to 10 p.m. The newest member to the Luminary culinary scene is Chips Sports Pub , with a Topgolf Swing Suite open Sunday from 11 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Wednesday and Thursday from 3 to 10 p.m.; Friday from 3 to 11 p.m.; and Saturday from 11 a.m. to 11 p.m. Full menus and other information on each outlet can be found online . For more information on Luminary Hotel & Co., visit LuminaryHotel.com . # # # About Luminary Hotel & Co. On Sept. 23, 2020, the waterfront Luminary Hotel & Co. opened its doors, soaring 12 stories above downtown Fort Myers, Florida, as the area’s first hotel in the prestigious Autograph Collection® of Marriott International. More than a hotel, the AAA Four Diamond Luminary is a hub of excitement and discovery – a focal point where locals and travelers tap into the collective energy of a city, and a story, begun by a brilliant cast of audacious local luminaries. The 243-room boutique hotel is home to the signature Silver King Ocean Brasserie and Lobby Bar; Beacon Social Drinkery rooftop lounge; Ella Mae's Diner; Oxbow Bar & Grill; Dean Street Coffee Roastery & Retail; Chips Sports Pub & Topgolf Swing Suite; The Workshop culinary theater; an indoor and outdoor fitness facility; and a spacious pool area on the fourth floor featuring an event deck overlooking the Caloosahatchee River. Luminary offers 10,000 square feet of adaptable indoor and outdoor function space ideal for a variety of events and meetings and is adjacent to the neighboring Caloosa Sound Convention Center. The hotel also offers convenient access to the new Caloosa Sound Amphitheater located on the Caloosahatchee. Stay Sojo, Mainsail’s newest brand, provides short-term furnished living options across the country, while Mainsail Vacation Rentals manages a collection of private vacation homes in Florida and the Caribbean. To ensure long-term success and profitability, Mainsail relies on the dedication of its high-performing associates, a growing group of enterprising investors, and a commitment to giving back, every step of the way. Careers What To Expect Insurances Accepted Pay My Bill About Our Story Leadership Our Programs Inpatient Intensive Outpatient Private Practice Locations Signs & Symptoms Resources Resources Caregivers Select Page Leadership Sean Wendell, CPA Chief Executive Officer John Roberts Chief Financial Officer Rob Jardeleza Chief Operating Officer Tabatha Golding Sr. VP of Outpatient Relations Sean Wendell, CPA Chief Executive Officer Sean Wendell is the CEO & part-owner of Beacon Behavioral Health. He also serves on the Board of Directors. Sean has over 26 years of behavioral healthcare experience. Before joining Beacon in May of 2000, Sean gained valuable knowledge of healthcare management, serving as an auditor specializing in the healthcare industry with one of the nation’s leading accounting firms. Prior to his promotion to CEO, he served as Beacon’s Chief Administrative Officer and Chief Finance Officer. Born and raised in Little Rock, AR, Sean now resides in Baton Rouge, Louisiana with his wife of 24 years and three children. He is an active member of his community, serving on multiple committees and boards, including an executive committee and capital campaign committee responsible for building a new church and school. In his free time, he enjoys playing tennis, reading, snow skiing, and spending time with his family. Accomplishments Leadership and experience have afforded Sean the opportunity to lead multiple initiatives in business development, operations, recruitment and retention, and revenue cycle management: Promoted to CFO quickly after joining Beacon as Sr. VP of Finance Consolidated multiple business lines, focusing solely on home care and behavioral health, resulting in a significant increase in revenue and net income as CFO Navigated the home care division from cost-based reimbursement to a prospective payment system, growing the home care division from two sites to 18 sites, covering all of Louisiana Successfully took the home care division through PE sale in March 2007 Promoted to CEO in March 2007 and became a part-owner Focused on growing and expanding the behavioral health division from one site offering PHP to 20 sites offering PHP, IOP, inpatient, residential, and traditional outpatient services after selling the home care division management Education Henderson State University Bachelor of Business Administration – BBA, Accounting ” The two hardest things to handle in life are failure and success. “ – Sean Wendell John Roberts Chief Financial Officer As Chief Financial Officer of Beacon Behavioral, John Roberts oversees the company’s financial activities and directs its overall financial vision. He is responsible for ensuring the company’s profitability by developing and implementing strategies that drive the company’s long-term financial performance. John works in collaboration with the CEO and leadership team to ensure that Beacon’s operations and strategic growth plans are carried out in a successful manner. He actively plans, executes, and manages financial activities. This includes direct responsibility for financial operations, accounting, business integration, financial planning and analysis, and debt and equity financing. John has over twenty years of experience in the financial sector. He has built an impressive portfolio of accomplishments and valuable insights throughout this time. Prior to joining Beacon, John was the CFO for Harvard MedTech, an emerging digital health company utilizing virtual reality to deliver behavioral and social interventions for trauma recovery. John also served as the Divisional CFO for Fresenius Medical North America managing the company’s physician practice services division. He was formerly Vice President of Finance for National Cardiovascular Partners supporting multiple PE-backed transactions in a rapidly scaling business. In addition to his functional roles in FP&A, he also provided analytical support to both executives and board members in the hospitality industry. His vast experience in the healthcare sector and close collaboration with executives have enhanced his skills in financial planning and analysis. He is well experienced in building and leading high-performing teams while leveraging technology to drive process improvements. John has quickly become a key asset to the Beacon organization since joining in 2023. He has already helped identify areas of cost savings and revenue growth. His ability to quickly assess and understand complex financial problems will continue to be an asset to the Becon organization. John holds a Master of Science in Finance from Louisiana State University and completed the Professional Leadership Development at Harvard Business School. His studies have made him an astute financial advisor and officer, and his commitment to the health sector demonstrates his commitment to serving. His dedication to helping others is evident in his professional pursuits, and his education and experience make him an ideal financial leader. “We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.” – Winston Churchill Rob Jardeleza Chief Operating Officer As Chief Operating Officer, Rob Jardeleza brings over 15 years of executive healthcare leadership experience to Beacon Behavioral Partners. Joining the organization in 2024, Rob oversees all partner and team support initiatives, playing a pivotal role in driving operational excellence and growth strategies. Throughout his career in healthcare, Rob has successfully guided multiple physician partner groups through significant growth cycles and successful exits, demonstrating his expertise in operational management and strategic development within complex healthcare environments. Experience: Chief Execution Officer – Aligned Cardiovascular Partners Chief Executive Officer – Partners First Cardiology President – BPL Plasma Chief Operating Officer – National Cardiovascular Partners, LP Tabatha Golding Sr. VP of Outpatient Relations As Sr. VP of Outpatient Operations at Beacon, Tabatha is responsible for improving the quality of patient care, encouraging the company to meet vital financial goals, and building strong employee retention rates. She is also responsible for supervising Beacon’s 9 IOP clinics and 4 private practice divisions. Tabatha has worked in behavioral health management for over 10 years and has been with Beacon for 7 years. Prior to her time at Beacon, she served as the Director of the Outpatient Clinic, Intake Coordinator, and Marketing Representative at Magnolia Behavioral Healthcare for 4 years. Additionally, Tabatha worked in real estate management and served at the same company for 8 years. Born and raised in Ponchatoula, Louisiana, Tabatha lives with her husband of 10 years and their 2 children, a 14-year-old daughter and an 8-year-old son. When she isn’t spending time with her family, she enjoys hiking, reading, cooking, and traveling. “ I approach everyone I see daily with kindness. I show each person that I encounter the respect they deserve. I deliver when I say I will deliver and let everyone have a voice. I always remain approachable and keep an open-door policy. The clients always come first and their treatment is always at the center of everything I do.” – Tabatha Golding We're Here For You. Contact Us Learn More About How We Can Help. Battling depression, anxiety, bipolar, schizophrenia, or substance use issues isn't just a daily struggle—it's a profound and often overwhelming challenge. The weight of these difficulties may feel crushing and navigating them alone can seem impossible. We are here to remind you that you don't have to face this alone. You've come to the right place. Intensive Outpatient Program Inpatient Program Depression Depression affects emotions, thoughts, and daily activities. Symptoms include hopelessness, fatigue, loss of interest, poor judgment, and suicidal thoughts. Its pervasive impact can severely hinder an individual’s quality of life without proper treatment and support. Learn more… Bipolar Disorder Bipolar disorder causes intense mood swings from manic highs to depressive lows, with normal moods in between. Affecting over 7 million Americans, it requires lifelong treatment, including medication, therapy, and education to manage recurring episodes. Learn more… Anxiety Anxiety disorders create intense fear, distress, and unease in situations where most wouldn’t feel this way. If untreated, they can greatly reduce productivity and quality of life. Nearly one-third of U.S. adults experience an anxiety disorder at some point. Learn more… Addiction Addiction is a disorder marked by an overwhelming urge to use substances or engage in rewarding behaviors despite harmful consequences. It alters brain function, leading to repeated, self-destructive patterns that impact personal health, relationships, and daily responsibilities. Learn more… Mania Mania is marked by extreme mood elevation, heightened energy, and impulsive behavior. Symptoms include euphoria, restlessness, rapid speech, grandiose plans, and risky behaviors. Episodes vary in intensity, often disrupting personal and professional relationships. Learn more… S chizophrenia Schizophrenia distorts perception, thoughts, and behavior, leading to hallucinations, delusions, and withdrawal. The blurred lines between reality and imagination can create confusion, fear, and isolation. Consistent treatment is essential for managing symptoms. Learn more… Beacon's Mission - “To provide unsurpassed patient care in a compassionate, cost-effective, and ethical manner”—has been, and will always be, the cornerstone of Beacon’s success. October 2020 FORT MYERS, Fla. (Oct. 15, 2020) – Today, the Luminary Hotel & Co. officially opened the doors to Beacon Social Drinkery , its showcase rooftop bar which crowns the new boutique hotel in downtown Fort Myers. Perched atop the 12-story hotel, Beacon offers a wide variety of wines, craft cocktails and beers to complement a sophisticated tapas-style menu, all served with breathtaking views from high above the Caloosahatchee River. Beacon Social Drinkery is open Sunday through Thursday from 4 p.m. to 11 p.m. and Friday through Saturday 4 p.m. to midnight. Capacity will be managed on a first-come, first-served basis. “We are thrilled to open Beacon as a sophisticated nightspot for our guests and local residents alike,” said Bob Megazzini, General Manager for Luminary Hotel & Co. “The views are spectacular, and the setting truly one-of-a-kind for this market.” While taking in the nearly 360-degree views of the riverfront and downtown area, guests at Beacon can explore an impressive menu of specialty drinks, local craft beers, wines and “bubbles.” The rooftop bar menu of tantalizing small plates features Pan Asian and Latin-inspired selections such as Tuna Tataki, Snapper Ceviche, Spicy Chicken “Mole” Empanadas, Lemongrass Shrimp Sliders and more. The unique 1600-square-feet space will also provide a new option for private social or corporate gatherings. Beacon Social Drinkery can comfortably accommodate up to 120 guests, with seating for 105. Luminary Hotel & Co. features 243 guest rooms and suites; The Silver King Ocean Brasserie, scheduled to open in November; The Lobby Bar; Ella Mae's Diner; Dean Street Coffee Roastery & Retail; The Workshop culinary theater; an indoor and outdoor fitness facility; and a spacious pool area on the fourth floor featuring an event deck overlooking the Caloosahatchee River. The hotel is located just 16 miles (less than 30 minutes) from the award-winning Southwest Florida International Airport (RSW), one of the top 50 U.S. airports for passenger traffic. For more information on Beacon Social Drinkery and Luminary Hotel & Co., visit LuminaryHotel.com . # # # About Luminary Hotel & Co. On Sept. 23, 2020, the waterfront Luminary Hotel & Co. opened its doors, soaring 12 stories above downtown Fort Myers, Florida, as the area’s first hotel in the prestigious Autograph Collection® of Marriott International. More than a hotel, Luminary is a hub of excitement and discovery – a focal point where locals and travelers tap into the collective energy of a city, and a story, begun by a brilliant cast of audacious local luminaries. The 243-room boutique hotel is home to the signature Silver King Ocean Brasserie and Lobby Bar; Beacon Social Drinkery rooftop lounge; Ella Mae's Diner; Dean Street Coffee; The Workshop culinary theater; an indoor and outdoor fitness facility; and a spacious pool area on the fourth floor featuring an event deck overlooking the Caloosahatchee River. Luminary offers 10,000 square feet of adaptable indoor and outdoor function space ideal for a variety of events and meetings and is adjacent to the neighboring Caloosa Sound Convention Center. The hotel also offers convenient access to the new riverfront Oxbow Bar & Grill, Oxbow Retail & Rentals, and Caloosa Sound Amphitheater, all located on the Caloosahatchee and scheduled to open in 2021. Their property portfolio includes five Autograph Collection hotels: Scrub Island Resort, Spa & Marina ( ScrubIsland.com ), a private island resort in the British Virgin Islands; the boutique, food-focused Epicurean Hotel ( EpicureanHotel.com ) in Tampa, Florida; Waterline Marina Resort ( WaterlineResort.com ) on Anna Maria Island, Florida; the historic Fenway Hotel ( FenwayHotel.com ) in Dunedin, Florida and the riverfront Luminary Hotel & Co. ( LuminaryHotel.com ) in downtown Fort Myers, Florida; as well as Mainsail Beach Inn ( MainsailBeachInn.com ), a boutique beachfront hotel on Anna Maria Island, Florida and The Karol Hotel ( TheKarolHotel.com ), the first Tribute Portfolio hotel in Pinellas County, Florida. The company also operates corporate housing throughout the U.S. under its Mainsail Corporate Housing brand ( MainsailHousing.com ). Mainsail Lodging also manages a portfolio of private vacation homes through its Mainsail Vacation Rentals ( MainsailVR.com ) offered on Homes & Villas by Marriott International. Additional future projects include the 179-room Epicurean Atlanta ( EpicureanHotelAtlanta.com ); a 128-room Residence Inn in conjunction with an indoor sports complex in Pasco County, Florida; Wylie Hotel, an independent boutique hotel in Atlanta’s Old Fourth Ward ( WylieHotel.com ); and a historic boutique hotel in Macon, Georgia. Mainsail Lodging’s corporate charity is Feeding Tampa Bay, the largest food rescue and distribution organization in the community. Mainsail actively supports the cause through a variety of employee and guest programs ranging from packing and sorting at the warehouse, to annual events such as the Epic Chef Showdown.
